bind.relevant: selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-redMUAC') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-feetSwelling') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-unconscious') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-convulsions') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-problemsEatingAndDrinking') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-vomitingEverything') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-bloodInStool') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-coughingMoreThan21Days') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-chestIndrawing') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-feverMoreThan7Days') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-diarrheaMoreThan14Days') or selected(/data/GRP-dangerSigns/LMD-CHK-dangerSigns, 'LMD-OPT-anyOtherProblem')

bind.calculate: " - Diarrhea (Running Stomach) for more than 14 days"

text.value: CHW ID is a unique number and must be greater than 0
Community ID must be greater than 0
Household ID must be greater than 0
Please write the first letter of the child's first name and child's last name. For example, if the child's name is Success Thomas, please write ST:
Initials must be 2 characters in length
Please only use letters to record the child's name
Please only use letters to record the child's name
What kind of visit is this?

How old is the child?
Years:
Child is under 2 months or over 5 years. Please focus only on providing care for children who are older than 2 months and younger than 5 years.
How did you find the child?
Passive case finding (Parent came to me)
Active case finding (CHW went to sick child or on routine visit)
Ask and look to see if the child has any DANGER SIGNS:
Unable to eat or drink anything
Any other problem you cannot treat
has the following danger signs and needs to be referred to a health facility.
Explain why the caregiver must take the child to a health facility
I have explained to the caregiver why the child must be moved to the health facility
PNEUMONIA: If the child can drink, give child first dose of oral antibiotics (amoxicillin)
Yes. I have given the child oral antibiotics (amoxicillin)
No. Oral antibiotics (amoxicillin) were not provided
MALARIA: Refer + Treat Malaria. Help caregiver give first dose of ACT and Paracetamol
Yes. I provided the first dose of ACT and Paracetamol
No. I did not provide the first dose of ACT and Paracetamol
Yes. I have given ORS to the child
No. I have not given ORS to the child
Advise the caregiver to give water and continue feeding the child
I have advised the caregiver to give fluids and continue feeding
Advise the caregiver to keep the child warm
I have advised the caregiver to keep the child warm
Advise the caregiver to keep the child cool
I have advised the caregiver to keep the child cool
Yes. I have completed the CHW Form: Referral
No. I have NOT completed the CHW Form: Referral
Arrange transport for the child and refer the child to the health facility
I have attempted and was successful in arranging transport for the child for a referral visit to the facility
I have attempted but was not successful in arranging transport for the child for a referral visit to the facility
Has the caregiver agreed to take child to health facility?
Child has no danger signs. Please look for the following symptoms which can be treated at home:
Please look for the following symptoms which can be treated at home:
Does the child have Yellow MUAC?
[Do not check MUAC during no touch period]
Child has fast breathing? - If 2-11 months: 50+ breaths per minute - If 1-5 years: 40+ breaths per minute
Child had fever in past 3 days?
Perform an RDT on the child
[Do not perform RDT during no touch period]
Yes, I gave the child an RDT
No, I did not give the child an RDT
What was the result of the RDT?
Has the child had 3 or more diarrhea (watery poo poos) in the last 24 hours?
Begin home treatment. has the following symptoms:
PNEUMONIA: Treat at home with Amoxicillin. Teach caregiver how to give treatment and watch caregiver give first dose now. Check caregiver's understanding and ask him/her to explain treatment plan
[Use dose card to determine correct treatment plan]
Yes, I told the caregiver and gave him/her Amoxicillin
No, I did not give the caregiver Amoxicillin
Why was treatment for Pneumonia not provided?
Treatment provided by outreach or clinic
MALARIA: Teach caregiver how to give treatment and watch caregiver give first ACT and Paracetamol doses now. Check caregiver's understanding and ask him/her to explain treatment plan
[Use dose card to determine correct treatment plan]
Yes, I informed the caregiver and gave child ACT and Paracetamol
No, I did not give the child ACT and Paracetamol
Why was treatment for Malaria not provided?
DIARRHEA: Teach caregiver how to give treatment and watch caregiver give first dose of ORS and Zinc now. Check caregiver's understanding and ask him/her to explain treatment plan
[Use dose card to determine correct treatment plan]
Yes, I informed the caregiver and gave child ORS and Zinc
No, I did not give the child ORS and Zinc
Why was treatment for Diarrhea not provided?
Yellow MUAC - Child is malnourished. Advise the caregiver on malnutrition and how to give child a balanced diet and good food. Notify your supervisor.
Yes, I advised on malnutrition and will notify my supervisor
No, I did not advise on malnutrition
Advise the caregiver to keep the child warm
Advise the caregiver to keep the child cool
Advise caregiver to give more fluids and continue feeding
Reminder: Follow up with the child
Child has no symptoms. Follow up with caregiver to make sure the child stays healthy
Treatment completed. Ask caregiver to return if the child has any other health problems
Child has not recovered in three follow up visits. Please notify your supervisor
